intro: Alvaradoa subovata, commonly known as the narrow-ovate alvaradoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its subovate (nearly oval) leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its compact growth form. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
